intro: Curculigo senporeiensis, commonly known as the Singapore arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Hyacinthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
